DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluate efficacy behavioral intervention , design prevent weight gain among overweight low obese ( 25-34.9 kg/m2 ) Black woman ( age 25-44 ) , compare usual care .
DOC.brief_title: Community Based Obesity Prevention Among Black Women
DOC.detailed_description: Obesity prevention among Black woman major public health priority ; presently , nearly 54 % adult Black female population obese . To date , intervention attention focus weight reduction among overweight obese . However , condition notoriously recalcitrant treatment , particularly among Blacks . We posit obesity prevention might represent particularly effective intervention strategy overweight Black woman . Most study show Black woman great social acceptance overweight , less body weight dissatisfaction , high ideal body weight , compare Whites . Furthermore , numerous study show obesity less lethal cause few co-morbidities among Black vs. White woman , suggest maintain overweight may appropriate public health goal Black woman . We posit intervention approach emphasize maintain overweight , prevent transition obesity resonate among target population . Very obesity prevention RCTs appear publish literature , knowledge , none conduct solely among Black woman . We propose randomize overweight , Black woman ( n=184 ) either usual care ( UC ) obesity prevention ( OP ) intervention condition . The OP condition comprise several intervention component deliver 12 month ; participant receive tailor action plan , tailor print material , monthly coaching call , weekly self-monitoring via interactive voice response system . Assessments take baseline , 6 , 12 , 18 month post baseline .
DOC.criteria: AfricanAmerican Female Ages 2544 BMI 2534.9 kg/m2 Patients least 1 visit previous 24 month participate Community Health Center Not currently pregnant Not give birth within past 12 month No history myocardial infarction stroke last 2 year
